name: Cocaina
Relationship: Compare: STOVAIN (an analgesic, a vasomotor dilator.) Antidote to disagreeable effects occasionally resulting from injection of cocaine into skin or gums, drop doses of nitro-glycer. 1% sol.

Eyes: Glaucoma, increased tension, decreased corneal sensibility
Stomach: Loss of appetite for solid food
Chorea; paralysis agitans; alcoholic tremors and senile trembling
Formication and numbness in hands and forearms
Restless, cannot sleep for hours after retiring
Mind: Constant desire to do something great, TO UNDERTAKE VAST FEATS OF STRENGTH
Frightful persecutory hallucinations; SEES AND FEELS BUGS AND WORMS
Thinks he hears unpleasant remarks about himself
Head: Throbbing and bursting sensation
PUPILS DILATED
Hearing greatly increased
Roaring and noises in head
Throat: Dry, burning, tickling, constricted, paralysis of muscles of deglutition

details: Besides the great usefulness of Cocaine as a local anaesthetic, it has specific homeopathic uses, though the symptoms are mainly clinical only. Sensation AS IF SMALL FOREIGN BODIES OR WORMS WERE UNDER THE SKIN.
dosage: Lower potencies. As a local application to mucous membranes, 2-4%.
